org.epochx.ge.op.init
Class RampedHalfAndHalfInitialiser

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.op.ConfigOperator<GEModel>
      org.epochx.ge.op.init.RampedHalfAndHalfInitialiser
All Implemented Interfaces:
GEInitialiser, ConfigListener, Listener, Initialiser, Operator
public class RampedHalfAndHalfInitialiser
extends ConfigOperator<GEModel>
implements GEInitialiser

Initialisation implementation which uses a combination of full and grow initialisers to create an initial population of GECandidatePrograms. For full details of how the initialisation operator works see Chapter 8: Sensible Initialisation, of Grammatical Evolution by O'Neill and Ryan.

Depths are equally split between depths from the minimum possible depth up to the maximum initial depth. Initialisation of programs with parse trees down to each of these depths is then alternated between full and grow initialisers starting with grow. The depth of the programs is controlled by mapping the generated codons in a depth first manner.

There will not always be an equal number of programs created to each depth, this will depend on if the population size is exactly divisible by the range of depths (initial maximum depth - initial minimum depth). If the range of depths is greater than the population size then some depths will not occur at all in order to ensure as wide a spread of depths up to the maximum as possible.

If a model is provided then the following parameters are loaded upon every configure event:

  • population size
  • maximum initial program initialDepth
  • syntax
  • random number generator

If the getModel method returns null then no model is set and whatever static parameters have been set as parameters to the constructor or using the standard accessor methods will be used. If any compulsory parameters remain unset when the initialiser is requested to generate new programs, then an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

See Also:
FixedLengthInitialiser, FullInitialiser, GrowInitialiser

Field Detail

INIT_GROWN

public static final Stat INIT_GROWN
Requests an boolean[] which has one element per program initialised by this RH+H initialiser. A value of true indicates the program was initialised with grow, and false indicates full initialisation was used.

Method Detail

onConfigure

public void onConfigure()
Description copied from class: ConfigOperator
Configures the operator with parameters from the model. This method will be called at the appropriate times to configure this component. Implementing classes should override this method to setup the operator with any parameters required from the model. If no model is set then this instance will not be subscribed to configure events and so alternative means must be used to configure it.

Specified by:
onConfigure in interface ConfigListener
Overrides:
onConfigure in class ConfigOperator<GEModel>

getInitialPopulation

public java.util.List<CandidateProgram> getInitialPopulation()
Will use grow initialisation on half the population and full on the other half. If the population size is an odd number then the extra individual will be initialised with grow.

Specified by:
getInitialPopulation in interface GEInitialiser
Specified by:
getInitialPopulation in interface Initialiser
Returns:
A List of newly generated CandidatePrograms which will form the initial population for a GP run.

isDuplicatesEnabled

public boolean isDuplicatesEnabled()
Returns whether or not duplicates are currently accepted or rejected from generated populations.

Returns:
true if duplicates are currently accepted in any populations generated by the getInitialPopulation method and false otherwise

setDuplicatesEnabled

public void setDuplicatesEnabled(boolean acceptDuplicates)
Sets whether duplicates should be allowed in the populations that are generated, or if they should be discarded.

Parameters:
acceptDuplicates - whether duplicates should be accepted in the populations that are constructed.

setModel

public void setModel(GEModel model)
Sets a model that will provide the configuration for this operator. The necessary parameters will be obtained from the model the next time, and each time a configure event is triggered. Note that until a configure event is fired this operator may be in an unusable state. Any previously set parameters will stay active until they are overwritten at the next configure event.

If a model is already set, it may be cleared by calling this method with null.

Overrides:
setModel in class ConfigOperator<GEModel>
Parameters:
model - the model to set or null to clear any current model.

setRNG

public void setRNG(RandomNumberGenerator rng)
Sets the random number generator to use. If a model has been set then this parameter will be overwritten with the random number generator from that model on the next configure event.

Parameters:
rng - the random number generator to set.

getGrammar

public Grammar getGrammar()
Returns the grammar that this initialiser is generating programs to satisfy. It is using this grammar that the initialiser will map the program's codons to determine the parse tree depth.

Returns:
the grammar that generated programs are being constructed for.

setGrammar

public void setGrammar(Grammar grammar)
Sets the grammar that should be used to determine which codons to use to create a program parse tree within the set depth limitations.

Parameters:
grammar - the Grammar that generated programs should be constructed for.

getPopSize

public int getPopSize()
Returns the size of the populations that this initialiser constructs or -1 if none has been set.

the size of the populations that this initialiser will generate.

Sets the size of the populations that this initialiser should construct on calls to the getInitialPopulation method.

Parameters:

getEndMaxDepth

public int getEndMaxDepth()
Returns the final maximum depth that will be used for programs this initialiser generates. Program depths will have been gradually ramped up to this value from the start max depth.

Returns:
the maximum depth the program trees constructed should be.

setEndMaxDepth

public void setEndMaxDepth(int endMaxDepth)
Sets the maximum depth used for the parse trees of the programs this initialiser constructs. Depths will be ramped up to this maximum depth.

Parameters:
endMaxDepth - the maximum depth of the ramping process.

getStartMaxDepth

public int getStartMaxDepth()
Returns the first maximum depth that will be used for programs this initialiser generates. Program depths will then be gradually ramped up to the end max depth.

Returns:
the maximum depth used for the first program trees before the depth is ramped up to the end max depth.

setStartMaxDepth

public void setStartMaxDepth(int startMaxDepth)
Sets the first maximum depth used for program trees this initialiser constructs. Depths will be ramped up from here to the end maximum depth.

Parameters:
startMaxDepth - the maximum depth to be used for the smallest set of program trees.

setMaxCodonValue

public void setMaxCodonValue(int maxCodonValue)
Sets the maximum value that codons chosen by this initialiser should take.

Parameters:
maxCodonValue - the maximum integer value that codons selected by this initialiser should take.
